704914f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hicks Street - Orange Street
704914f-a.text:
B7 to 99 Hicks Street, east side, south from Orange
to Pineapple Streetf.
June 11, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
704914f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY

706135f-a.title: Brooklyn: Orange Street - Hicks Street
706135f-a.text:
Orange Street, east from Hicks Street. The view shows a modern
addition, the Institute (in the foreground) of the old Plymouth Church,
formerly the church of Henry Ward Beecher.
1928.
C. P. Cushing.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
706135f-a.folder: Orange Street & Hicks Street, Brooklyn, NY

706139f-a.title: Brooklyn: Orange Street - Hicks Street
706139f-a.text:
Orange Street, between Hicks and Henry Streets. The view shows
the statue of Henry Ward Beecher, by Gutzon Borglum, at the Congregational
Plymouth Church.
1928.
Ewing Walloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
706139f-a.folder: Orange Street & Hicks Street, Brooklyn, NY

704913f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hicks Street - Orange Street
704913f-a.text:
78..77 Hicks Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Orange Street,
showing the home (No. 77) of the Rev. S.B. Halliday, adjoining the corner.
This site is now, 1929, occupied by the Plymouth Institute.
About 1895.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
704913f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY

704915f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hicks Street - Orange Street
704915f-a.text:
Hicks Street, at the N.W. corner of Orange Street, showing a house
raned in 1886. It is said that Joel Bunce, the first Postmaster of Brodclyn,
(about 1819) ocoupied it. It was also occupied for some years by the artist
Thomas Nast.
About 1886.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
704915f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY

704916f-b.title: Brooklyn: Hicks Street - Orange Street
704916f-b.text:
(1)
Hicks Street, north fromm Orange Street. On the right
is a portion of Plymouth Institute, connected with the
Plymouth 9hurch, on Orange Street. The old peaked-roof
house (white wall) was the home and cracker bakery of
D. K. Ducker, at the N. E. corner o5 Cranberry Street.
The firm later became known as Hatfield and Ducker.
April. 1925
Eugene L. Armbruster
MAY BE REPRODUCED
(2)
The same, at a later date, viewing across Orange
Street and showing Plymouth Institute in its entirety.
June 11, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
704916f-b.folder: Hicks Street & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY

706132f-b.title: Brooklyn: Orange Street - Hicks Street
706132f-b.text:
Orange Street, adjoining the N. E. corner of Hicks Street,
showing the Plymouth Institute and the Henry Ward Beecher monu-
ment. The statue of the famous Brookl7n preacher was executed
by Gutson Borglum.
View 1: June 11, 1927
View 2: April 4, 1932
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

706133f.title: Brooklyn: Orange Street - Hicks Street
706133f.text:
Orange Street, at the N.E. corner of Hicks Street, showing the
home of the Rev. L.B. Halliday. In 1929 the Plymouth Church buildings
occupied the site.
Date 7
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

706134f-a.title: Brooklyn: Orange Street - Hicks Street
706134f-a.text:
52-58 Orange Street, south side, east of Hicks Street.
April 4, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
